title: Low-energy high-time resolution electron fluxes ~0.02-1.0 MeV (with spin accumulations plotted at end of accumulation in sector order) - Lou Lanzerotti (New Jersey Institute of Technology)

info.x_cadence_note: Counts based on variable 'Epoch' in https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/sp_phys/data/rbsp/rbspa/l2/rbspice/esrleht/2012/rbsp-a-rbspice_lev-2_esrleht_20121113_v1.2.4-00.cdf. The most common cadence occurred for 37.4565% of the 4197 timesteps. Cadence = 607000000 [ns] = PT0.607S.
info.contact: Lou Lanzerotti @ New Jersey Institute of Technology

parameters.name: Time
parameters.x_description: Ephemeris Time of the start  of the accumulation for this measurement.

parameters.name: FEDU
parameters.description: FEDU: Electron flux spectrograms in energy, by telescope in sector order (T0= ~110 PA, T3= ~all PAs, T5= FEDU background)

bins.name: Telescope
bins.description: Identifies the telescope used to collect the measurement

bins.name: FEDU_Energy_1Darray
bins.description: Midpoint energy of the measurement channel. A value of -1 indicates that an energy definition for this channel is not applicable

parameters.name: FEDU_stack1
parameters.description: ---> Telescope 1: stacked plots by energy. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function make_stack_array (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['FEDU']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

bins.name: FEDU_Energy_1Darray
bins.description: Midpoint energy of the measurement channel. A value of -1 indicates that an energy definition for this channel is not applicable

parameters.name: Sector
parameters.description: ---> The current sector number where each spin is divided into 36 sectors.

parameters.name: Spin
parameters.description: ---> The current spin number of the spacecraft

parameters.name: OrbitNumber
parameters.description: Orbit Number at the time of the measurement

parameters.name: L
parameters.description: ---> Dipole L value calculated using the SM Reference Frame and taken from the definitive SPICE SPK kernels that are available at the time.

parameters.name: Position_SM
parameters.description: ---> Position of the spacecraft in SM coordinates

parameters.name: OrbitNumber_TT
parameters.description: [Labels on plots] Orbit Number at the time of the measurement. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function alternate_view (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['OrbitNumber']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: L_TT
parameters.description: ---> [Labels on plots] Dipole L value calculated using the SM Reference Frame and taken from the definitive SPICE SPK kernels that are available at the time.. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function alternate_view (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['L']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: Position_SM_TT
parameters.description: ---> [Labels on plots] Position of the spacecraft in SM coordinates. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function alternate_view (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['Position_SM'].
